primes

Class PrimeCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask<V>
      • java.util.concurrent.RecursiveTask<java.lang.Integer>
        • primes.PrimeCounter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer>

    public class PrimeCounter
extends java.util.concurrent.RecursiveTask<java.lang.Integer>
    A class to count the number of prime numbers under certain thresholds. PrimeCounter runs in parallel using ForkJoin on available processors so it runs considerably faster on multi-core machines than a sequential version.
    Version:
    CIT594 Spring 2013, 4/6/2013
    Author:
    Michael McLaughlin, mvm@cis.upenn.edu
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method for PrimeCounter, calculates the number of primes under: 1,000 10,000 100,000 1,000,000 10,000,000 (the limit set by Dave in class and on Piazza) Also times and prints the duration required to calculate those numbers.

      • Methods inherited from class java.util.concurrent.RecursiveTask
